Method of specifying vertical hydraulic conductivity (HGUVANI).
The user can specify the vertical hydraulic conductivity of a hydrogeologic unit in either of two ways:

li.text: Vertical hydraulic conductivity (VK parameters must be used)
Ratio of horizontal to vertical hydraulic conductivity. (If present, VK parameters represent vertical anisotropy. VK parameters are ignored if a VANI parameter is defined for the hydrogeologic unit.)

para.text: Ratio of horizontal to vertical hydraulic conductivity (HGUVANI).

If vertical anisotropy is used to define the vertical hydraulic conductivity and now VK or VANI parameters are used in a particular row and column for the hydrogeologic unit, the value of HGUVANI will be used as the vertical anisotropy for that location.
